newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Leftist Israeli lawmaker attacked by Jew in Hebron.
newsitem.headline: Leftist Israeli lawmaker attacked by Jew in Hebron.

text.p: A religious Jew threw hot tea in the face of Yael Dayan, a leftist member of the Israeli parliament, while she toured the West Bank town of Hebron on Tuesday.
"A Jew with a kippa (skullcap)...came up to me and asked if I wanted a cup of tea. And I said sure, and I have on my face scalding tea and on my chest," she told Israel Radio.
Dayan, daughter of the late Israeli general Moshe Dayan, was treated in an ambulance in Hebron for burns to her face and chest and did not require hospitalisation.
"Arrest him. Arrest him," a stunned Dayan said as steam rose from her face on a main Hebron street.
Israel Television, which carried footage of the incident, said her attacker, apparently a Jewish settler, fled the scene.
About 400 settlers live among 100,000 Palestinians in Hebron, the focus of Israeli-PLO talks on implementing a long overdue army redeployment in the town.
Dayan is a member of the main opposition Labour party which signed a 1995 deal with the PLO providing for Israeli handover of most of Hebron to Palestinian self-rule.
